Today, the traditional Hungarian folk costume is not commonly worn in daily life. It is primarily reserved for festivals, national holidays, and traditional folk dance performances. However, there are still individuals and communities who wear the folk costume on special occasions like weddings, christenings, and other celebrations.

In recent years, there has been a growing interest in Hungarian culture, including the folk costume. Some people have taken up the practice of wearing more traditional clothing as a way of celebrating their heritage and connecting with their cultural roots. 

Overall, while the traditional Hungarian folk costume is not regularly worn in daily life, it continues to play a significant role in preserving and promoting Hungarian culture and identity.
